author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: أَسْئَلُكَ يا إِلهِي بِهِمْ وَبِالزَّفَراتِ الَّتِيْ تَخْرُجُ مِنْ قُلُوبِهِمْ فِيْ فِراقِكَ، بِأَنْ تَحْفَظَهُمْ مِنْ شَرِّ أَعْدائِكَ، وَتَرْزُقَهُمْ ما قَدَّرْتَه لأَوْلِيائِكَ الَّذِينَ لا خَوْفٌ عَلَيْهِمْ وَلا هُمْ يَحْزَنُونَ.
translation: I beseech Thee, O my God, by them and by the sighs which their hearts utter in their separation from Thee, to keep them safe from the mischief of Thine adversaries, and to nourish their souls with what Thou hast ordained for Thy loved ones on whom shall come no fear and who shall not be put to grief.
